brief_summary.textblock:
To inversitage whether routine warming of blood is harmful to brain fuction of sugical
      patients receiving massive transfusion.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Heating Transfusion on Brain Function

detailed_description.textblock:
Hypothermia is an effective therapeutic intervention to reduce hypoxic ischemia brain injury
      in animal experiments and in clinics.In a recent study, it has been shown that perioperative
      warming was associated with a higher incidence of cognitive dysfunction in elderly
      patients.Therefore, we hypothesised that perioperative heating transfusion have a side
      effect on brain function of surgical patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult patients scheduled for major surgery under general anesthesia and they probably
             need a blood transfusion during the procedure.

        Exclusion Criteria:•Patients with a history of stroke, central nervous system disease ,
        metabolic disturbance, psychiatric illness, hearing impairment, drug abuse or unwilling to
        participate in assessment

        -

study_pop.textblock: adult paitents scheduled for major surgery.

facility.name: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Heating Transfusion on Brain Function of Surgical Patients

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline at 3hour, 6hour, 12hour, 24hour after  transfusion

oversight_info.authority: China: Ministry of Science and Technology

primary_outcome.description: Brain function includes cerebral blood flow and cerebral oxygen saturation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at post-transfusion 15min, 30min, 1hour, 2hour, 3 hour, 6hour, 12hour, 24hour

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: the cognitive performance and the score of postoperative quality recovery scales ( PQRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Chang from baseline at 15min,40min,1day,3day and 7day postoperative lay

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
